entry.description: Treatment with an antiviral drug used for treatment of cytomegalovirus infection.
entry.synonym: anti-viral treatment of cytomegalo virus therapy
antiviral treatment of cytomegalo virus therapy

entry.description: A substance that destroys or inhibits replication of viruses.
Treatment with a drug used for the treatment and prophylaxis of infection with influenza viruses.
Treatment with an antiviral agent that destroys or inhibits the replication of the herpes simplex virus.
Treatment with an antiviral agent that destroys or inhibits the replication of the herpes simplex virus-1.
Treatment with an antiviral agent that destroys or inhibits the replication of the herpes simplex virus-2.
Treatment with an antiviral agent that destroys or inhibits the replication of the human immunodeficiency virus.
entry.synonym: treatment with anti-human immunodeficiency virus activities
treatment with anti-human immunodeficiency virus activity
treatment with anti-human immunodeficiency virus agent
treatment with anti-human immunodeficiency virus drug
treatment with anti-human immunodeficiency virus medication

entry.description: A substance that destroys or inhibits replication of viruses.
A compound which inhibits or antagonizes the biosynthesis or actions of proteases (endopeptidases).
A compound which inhibits or antagonizes the biosynthesis or actions of proteases (endopeptidases).
A substance that destroys or inhibits replication of viruses.
A substance that destroys or inhibits replication of viruses.
Reverse-transcriptase inhibitors (RTIs) are a class of antiretroviral drugs used to treat HIV infection or AIDS, and in some cases hepatitis B
A substance that destroys or inhibits replication of viruses.
A substance that destroys or inhibits replication of viruses.
An agent that inhibits formation of virus particles.
A virucide is any physical or chemical agent that deactivates or destroys viruses. This differs from an anti-viral drug, which inhibits the proliferation of the virus.
